com.travelbank.knit.components.graph

Class UsageGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.travelbank.knit.components.graph.UsageGraph

  • public class UsageGraph
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the core of smart life-cycle management of all components. This class creates a dependency tree with all components created by KnitProcessor. Receives all components from ModelMapInterface and ViewToPresenterMapInterface, assigns a ComponentTag to each one then inserts them into the graph via EntityNodes . In the tree hierarchy, Entities annotated with KnitView will be at the top. The initialization of the views will trigger the initialization of the entities that the view requires. KnitView -> Presenter -> Model. Initialized components will be put into a Map that holds their instances until they're released. Each of the annotated entities will have an internal counterpart that Knit uses. KnitView -> As is Presenter -> KnitPresenter -> InternalPresenter Model -> KnitModel -> InternalModel However the initialization will be done in a bottom-up manner. Meaning InternalModels will be created first. Then InternalPresenter
    See Also:
    InternalModel, InternalPresenter, ModelManager

    • Method Detail

      • createGraph

        private void createGraph()
        This is the method that creates the graph. Extracts generated values from ModelMapInterface, extract required values from ViewToPresenterMapInterface. <<<<<<< HEAD Even though the entry point of all components is the creation of a view, the graph does not need to hold any kind of view data other than it's presenter. So the base of the graph consists of presenter data. Based on the required values of each presenter , it finds the model that generates those values, Then recursively checks if that model depends on another model(Umbrella Model). If the model indeed depends on another, then it will recurse until dependency graph is created. ======= Even though the entry point of all components is the creation of a view, the graph does not need to hold any kind of view data other than it's presenter. Based on the required values of each presenter , it finds the model that generates those values, Then recursively checks if that model depends on another model(Umbrella Model). If the model indeed depends on another, then it will recurse until there are no umbrella models left. >>>>>>> remotes/origin/docs

      • recurseAndCreateModel

        private void recurseAndCreateModel(java.lang.Class<? extends InternalModel> modelClazz,
                                   EntityNode modelNode,
                                   java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends InternalModel>> models,
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<? extends InternalModel>,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> generatedValuesMap,
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<? extends InternalModel>,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> requiredValuesMap)
        This is the recursive method that creates the model dependencies.
        Parameters:
        modelClazz - Model class that is being worked on
        modelNode - Node for that contains the current model.
        models - List of all models in the environment.
        generatedValuesMap - Map of all values generated by each InternalModel
        requiredValuesMap - Map of all values required by each InternalModel

        Parameters:
        clazz - Given InternalModel class.

        See Also:

      • isComponentCreated

        private boolean isComponentCreated(java.lang.Object viewObject)
        Returns true if there already is an active(Initialized) Component for a particular view object. Since views may be destroyed during events such as configuration changes, we need this method to determine whether components exists or not. Checks the graph base for the particular view, returns false if it doesn't exists as this this means that view isn't a part of Knit domain(Does not have KnitView annotation). Otherwise iterates through all next fields of the EntityNode associated with that view and if there is an available instance, returns true. If not, returns false.

      • startViewAndItsComponents

        public void startViewAndItsComponents(java.lang.Object viewObject)
        Attaches a view object to an underlying presenter(InternalPresenter & required InternalModels). Initializes them if they aren't already initialized. For each entity that's initialized, an MemoryEntity.onCreate() method is called. Increments the UserCounter for each entity.
        Parameters:
        viewObject - View object (Either a Activity or a Fragment).
        See Also:
        EntityInstance, MemoryEntity

      • recurseTraverseTheGraphAndStartIfNeeded

        private void recurseTraverseTheGraphAndStartIfNeeded(ComponentTag tag,
                                                     java.lang.Object viewObject)
        Entry method for this#recurseForStart(EntityNode, Object) method. Starts recursion for initializing all components(InternalModel,InternalPresenter) for a particular view.
        Parameters:
        tag - Tag of the given View.
        viewObject - instance of the given view. This is only needed as this gets passed to the KnitPresenter inside PresenterInterface.onViewApplied(java.lang.Object) method.

      • recurseForStart

        private void recurseForStart(EntityNode entityNode,
                             java.lang.Object viewObject)
        Recursive method that initializes all components and stores their instances. Runs a DFS to start all models first. Also handles the lifecylce methods such as MemoryEntity.onCreate().
        Parameters:
        entityNode - Entry point of the graph. EntityNode of a view.
        viewObject - Instance of the view that is getting it's dependencies started.

      • handleMessageDelivery

        private void handleMessageDelivery(InternalPresenter presenter,
                                   ComponentTag tag)
        This method delivers the message sent from one InternalPresenter to another. Message is contained inside MessageTrain.
        Parameters:
        presenter - Presenter instance that will be receiving the message.
        tag - Tag of the Presenter. Used to fetch the class type.

      • stopViewAndItsComponents

        public void stopViewAndItsComponents(java.lang.Object viewObject)
        Decrements UserCounter of all entities depended on this view. If the counter reaches to 0, destroys them calling MemoryEntity.onDestroy()
        See Also:
        MemoryEntity

      • recurseTraverseTheGraphAndDestroyIfNeeded

        private void recurseTraverseTheGraphAndDestroyIfNeeded(ComponentTag tag)
        Entry method for this#recurseForFinish(EntityNode) method. Starts recursion for releasing all components(InternalModel,InternalPresenter) for a particular view. If the UserCounter becomes 0 for a particular component,they get destroyed.
        Parameters:
        tag - Tag of the given View.

      • recurseForFinish

        private void recurseForFinish(EntityNode entityNode)
        Recursive method that releases all components. Runs a DFS to release all models first. Also handles the lifecycle methods such as MemoryEntity.onDestroy(). If
        Parameters:
        entityNode - Entry point of the graph. EntityNode of a view.

      • extractViews

        private java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> extractViews(java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> views)
        ExtractViews from all component classes. Since views are indented by an Object.class object.
        Parameters:
        views - List of all views.
        Returns:
        returns a sublist of views. Without the Object.class .
